documentation.text:
@dev This data structure keeps track of all requests.
  NOTICE: the id of a request coincides with its index in the array.

@dev This event is emitted whenever a new request is created
  and saved inside the contract.

@dev This event is emitted whenever a request is correctly answered
  (i.e., the corresponding value is verified as authentic).

@dev Returns the total number of received requests.
 @return the total number of requests received by the contract

@dev Returns the number of served requests.
 @return the total number of requests served by the contract

@dev Returns the number of pending (i.e., not served) requests.
 @return the total number of pending requests

struct Bridge.Request storage ref[] storage ref

documentation.text: Returns the request with the specified identifier.

devdoc.author: Matteo Loporchio
devdoc.details: The main goal of this contract is to allow users  of a "source" blockchain C1 to read values from another "target" chain C2.  The value is guaranteed to be authentic thanks to appropriate  verification mechanisms based on cryptography.

RequestLogged(uint256,address,uint256,ui.details: This event is emitted whenever a new request is created  and saved inside the contract.

RequestServed(uint256,address,uint256,ui.details: This event is emitted whenever a request is correctly answered  (i.e., the corresponding value is verified as authentic).

getPending().details: Returns the number of pending (i.e., not served) requests.

returns._0: the total number of pending requests

getServed().details: Returns the number of served requests.

returns._0: the total number of requests served by the contract

getTotal().details: Returns the total number of received requests.

returns._0: the total number of requests received by the contract

request(address,uint256,uint256,uint256,.details: This function creates a new request and submits it to the contract.

params._blockId: the identifier of the block from which we want to read the state

returns._0: the identifier of the newly created request.  TODO: add liveness and request fee (and make the function payable).

verify(uint256,(bytes32,address,bytes[],.details: This method can be used to verify an Ethereum state proof.  The proof certifies that a given variable X inside a contract C  has a certain value V.  Ethereum state proofs are made up of two distinct parts:    1) An account proof, which certifies the existence of C.    2) A storage proof, which certifies the existence of X=V inside C.

requests.details: This data structure keeps track of all requests.  NOTICE: the id of a request coincides with its index in the array.

devdoc.title: Bridge smart contract for cross-chain query authentication

getRequest(uint256).notice: Returns the request with the specified identifier.
